result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Santiago Guerrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Miguel Santiago Guerrero is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Miguel Santiago Guerrero was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Miguel Santiago Guerrero in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Miguel Santiago Guerrero in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEAR, with credit for 10 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments out of cash bail on deposit.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge out of cash bail on deposit.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment or attend school
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with David B. 
-Attend Anger Management
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service
-Court does not allow for expungement 
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 90 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.   Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on May 12, 2016 at 5:00 p.m.

Justice Point Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court will address violation on the next Court date.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court addresses violation and admonishes defendant.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court will address violation at the next Court date.

Defendant Miguel Santiago Guerrero in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED and penalty enhancer of Use of a Dangerous Weapon striken on COUNT 1.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court will address violation on the next Court date.

Defense counsel requests the GPS Monitoring be removed. States does not object. Court orders that the defendant be removed from GPS Monitoring effective immediately. All other Justice Point conditions remain same.
